security_audit.summary: Pure documentation-based SOP with no executable code. Contains only YAML metadata, Markdown documentation, and a Graphviz diagram. No file system access, network calls, command execution, or code execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Gathering project requirements can be time-consuming and incomplete when done through linear conversation. This skill uses Claude Code's interactive question tool to systematically collect all necessary information through structured multi-select questions, ensuring nothing is missed.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through 5-phase requirements gathering workflow
Use AskUserQuestion tool for structured multi-select questions
Organize responses into formal specifications document
Validate completeness with stakeholder approval steps
limitations: Requires active user participation and responses
Does not execute code or access external systems
Relies on Claude Code's AskUserQuestion tool availability

use_cases.title: Kick off new projects
use_cases.description: Systematically gather all stakeholder requirements before project kickoff

use_cases.title: Clarify feature requests
use_cases.description: Extract detailed technical requirements from vague feature descriptions

use_cases.title: Document specifications
use_cases.description: Create comprehensive product specifications with clear acceptance criteria

prompt_templates.title: Basic Requirements
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to gather requirements for a new project. Please use the interactive planner to ask me initial discovery questions about project goals and scope.

prompt_templates.title: Technical Details
prompt_templates.prompt: Now follow up with detailed technical questions about scale, performance requirements, and technology constraints.

prompt_templates.title: Timeline and Resources
prompt_templates.prompt: Ask me about timeline expectations, resource constraints, and feature priorities using multi-select options.

prompt_templates.title: Final Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review all gathered requirements with me and create a final specifications document with action plan.

output_examples.input: Use interactive planner to gather requirements for a new e-commerce website
output: âœ“ Action plan created with 12 tasks

best_practices: Start with open questions about project goals before diving into technical details
Use multi-select options for priorities to surface trade-offs early
Validate requirements with stakeholders before creating the action plan
Document all responses in memory keys for future reference
anti_patterns: Skipping the discovery phase and jumping directly to technical questions
Using single-select when multiple priorities should be considered
Creating action plans without stakeholder validation
Failing to follow up on unclear or incomplete responses

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Requires AskUserQuestion tool availability.

faq.question: How long does the full requirements process take?
faq.answer: Plan for 15-30 minutes. Shorter sessions may result in incomplete requirements.

faq.question: Can I resume a partially completed session?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the documented memory keys to retrieve previous responses and continue from where you left off.

faq.question: Is any user data stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: No. Requirements are only stored in Claude Code's ephemeral context during the session.

faq.question: What if I get stuck or responses are unclear?
faq.answer: The workflow includes validation phases to catch gaps. Use follow-up questions to clarify ambiguous responses.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual requirements gathering?
faq.answer: Structured questions ensure nothing is missed. Multi-select options make priorities explicit. Stakeholder validation prevents misunderstandings.
